roleset.name: get
roleset.note: CATCH-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'catching' found in BOLT-7. Member of Vncls get-13.5.1. Comparison with 'get'. (from catch.01-v)
CATCH-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry catch.01, OntoNotes grouping catch-n senses 8& 9; maps to VN class get-13.5.1. (from catch.01-n)

example.name: catch-v: no giver
example.text: Inexplicably costumed as a rabbinical student, tottering around on lifts, Mr. Shicoff hardly seemed [the fellow]-2 *trace*-2 to catch a fancy cocotte's eye.

example.name: catch-v: with giver
example.text: John caught a long fly ball from his two-year old daughter.

example.name: catching-j
example.text: The rationality and maturity of Taiwan voters is eye - catching .
example.arg: The rationality and maturity of Taiwan

example.name: catching-n: Arg0, 1
example.text: His catching the ball was blocked by an over-enthusiastic fan in the stands.

example.name: catch-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: The juggler's catch of burning torches was impressive.

example.name: catch-n: Arg1 only
example.text: The credit for the catch of the burglar goes to the security guard on duty.

example.name: catch-n: All Arguments
example.text: His catch of the tipped ball from Chris Hooks ended the game and saved Hooks from losing any face.

example.name: catch-v: typical usage
example.text: But the government's action, which [*T*] caught Jaguar management flat-footed,...

example.name: catching-n: Arg0, 1
example.text: The FBI's catching of Whitey Bulgur was about 15 years late.

roleset.name: trap
roleset.note: CATCH-V NOTES: This latter example could be regarded as the attributive 'come upon'sense; at least the tagging is basically the same. (from catch.03-v)

example.name: catch-v: no trap mentioned
example.text: [Program trading itself]-1 is merely caught *trace*-1 in the middle of this battle, unfairly labeled as the evil driving force of the marketplace.
example.arg: in the middle of this battle
unfairly labeled as the evil driving force of the marketplace

example.name: catch-v: with trap
example.text: At the same time [it]-3 has been caught *trace*-3 in an earnings squeeze .

example.name: catch-v: metaphorical trap?
example.text: The scope of the improvement in the U.S. business caught some analysts by surprise.
example.arg: The scope of the improvement in the U.S. business

example.name: catching-n: super awkward
example.text: The catching of the bank robbers off guard was part of the SWAT plan

roleset.name: come even with, to catch up
roleset.note: KETCHUP-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in wsj-nw. Framed by Claire. Comparison to catch.04 (catch up). (from ketchup.01-v)
CATCH_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, catch_up-v. No VNcls. (from catch.02-n)

example.name: catch_up-v: stated goal
example.text: Meanwhile, Shearson Lehman's Mr. Devario said that, to stay competitive, [the U.S. paper industry]-1 needs *trace*-1 to catch upwith the European industry.

example.name: catch_up-v: no goal
example.text: ``[They]-1 are going *trace*-1 to catch up,'' said David Claridge, an analyst with Hambrecht& Quist.

example.name: ketchup-v: To ketchup or not to ketchup?
example.text: Public preference is important , So product names should match up , And firms that find they 're lagging behind Should now take steps whnp-2 *T*-2 to ketchup !

example.name: catch_up-n: typical corpus usage
example.text: Tokyo 's leading program traders are the big U.S. securities houses , though the Japanese are playing catch - up .

roleset.name: cause something to become entangled
roleset.note: CATCH_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to entangle. No Vncls (from catch.07-v)

example.name: catch_up-v/j: Adj/passive
example.text: He-1 got caught up *trace*-1 into it and became a different person .

example.name: catch_up-v: all args
example.text: the wind caught it up in little eddies and threw it at the window

roleset.name: catch on: become popular, becoming popular
roleset.note: CATCH_ON-V NOTES: Latter examples nicely fronted. (from catch.05-v)

example.name: catch_on-v: no audience
example.text: ...its Amiga, which has slick graphics yet has been slow [*T*] to catch on.

example.name: catch_on-v: with audience
example.text: And, with many of his 70,000 workers, Mr. Smith's damn-the-torpedoes attitude has caught on.

roleset.name: catch on: become aware of, becoming aware of

example.name: catch_on-v: you can't fool me!
example.text: At one point, the reader is two steps ahead of [Marlowe]-1 in *trace*-1 catching on to a double identity scam -- and Marlowe is supposed to be the pro.
